intro: Craterotecoma, commonly known as the African flame tree, is a deciduous tree native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Bignoniaceae family and is characterized by its striking orange-red flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant has compound leaves with elongated leaflets and produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular ornamental plant in tropical and subtropical regions. Its rapid growth and showy blooms make it a notable species in botanical gardens and landscaped areas.
